name: DoubleTree Club by Hilton Hotel Boston Bayside

reviews.text: This hotel is in need of a complete renovation, however, it is SPOTLESS clean and the staff is super nice. It is 5 train stops from downtown boston, and has a beautiful view of the city and the bay. Here is the consideration, do you want to pay 120.00 per night and walk 5 min to the T to be downtown, OR pay 240.00 per night and stay downtown (and still need to ride the T to get around)? I'll take the 120.00 and spend my extra money eating, drinking and shopping.
reviews.title: A cheap alternative to Downtown

reviews.text: Pros: Price and cleanliness Cons: No sit down restaurant and a short train ride into the city. No pool for the kids
reviews.title: Too far out for convenient sightseeing without a car.

reviews.text: I would stay here again!
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Excellent pickup from the airport after calling. Check in fine even late at night. Surprising though that all Hilton Honors members do not receive free internet and bottled water at check in!
reviews.title: Friendly staff, good location, good value, older property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room a tad on the small size. Beds very comfy with triple sheets. Nice toiletries with fragrance but not enough to set off an asthma attack. Carpet grungy with permanent marks on it .. needs changing. I did not want to walk barefoot on it!! Old school wall unit A/C that works well but noisy!
reviews.title: Cheap and near the T (red line)

reviews.text: Let me start by saying that I stay at a lot of Hilton brand properties. A LOT. I travel 50 weeks a year for business and have stayed at over 100 different Hilton brand hotels coast to coast. Typically Hampton Inns and Hilton Garden Inns, but I also stay at the occasional Doubletree or Hilton. I did something tonight that I've never done before, which is to check into a room at this hotel, then walk back to the front desk and tell them to check me out, I'm leaving. I am shocked (shocked!) that Hilton allows their name to be associated with this hotel, and have no idea how they have passed inspection (shame on the inspector -- Hilton needs to yank their brandage). It's not just that the entire room was outdated. The old, worn out carpet was stained. The one piece of upholstery was also stained. The wall vinyl seams were busting. Do not assume Hilton brand standard with this hotel. You'd be better off staying at the Hampton Inn Crosstown just a few miles away. You've been warned.
reviews.title: Not Hilton Standard - Shocked they passed inspection.

reviews.text: This hotel is located close to many attractions - JFK library and quick access to Boston.
reviews.title: Great Location - Other issues
Not The "Standard" I Expected for a Doubletree :-(
reviews.text: The check- in crew was friendly and efficient - the lobby was clean and spacious and included a small bar and vending machines. The room seemed clean but had some issues. Two light bulbs were missing, the coffee maker was only half functional and there were what seemed to be water stains on the wall. The heater/ AC unit was loud and the room temp. was difficult to control..too hot...too chilly. The beds were very comfortable with many fluffy pillows...quiet night.

This room came with breakfast. The catch was that you had to wait in line at least 20 minutes while one person made individual - special orders. There was no coffee in the lobby so you had to wait for that as well. We had to leave after standing in line for 15 minutes. Others in line also left due to time. The desk clerk did get us coffee after we told him about the line at the "cafe". The manager at that point should have called in a second person to man the breakfast crowd.
reviews.title: Not your typical Doubletree

reviews.text: This hotel has possibilities but seemed to be disorganized on a basic level. Doubletree usually has good quality hotels - this one fell short of their usual high standard.
reviews.title: Aging hotel but clean and friendly and very noisy! (walls are paper-thin)

reviews.text: The hotel is becomming outdated. Our room however was fine and non of the complaints others had occured during our stay. Only discomfort was a missing light bulb and a broken one. The airco is a "classic" and makes a lot of noise.
reviews.title: Comfortable location, fair price. At the end of its lifecycle

reviews.text: The pickup at the airport was OK. We had to wait for 15 minutes and it brought us to the hotel free of charge. During our stay we used th T tot go to town. For 2 dollar one way very cheap and only a 5 minute walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable & good value.

reviews.text: Complementary breakfast is very limited but OK. Free wireless internet in the lobby. Once you have logged in it became free in the room as well (magic!)
reviews.title: Dingy, dirty hotel with extremely poor service.

reviews.text: The shuttle back to the airport runs on the hour. It was not on a sign so we had to wait unfortunately. Very nice driver who dropped us at the rental car location instead of the airport.
reviews.title: A little disappointed with this Doubletree

reviews.text: If you don't expect too much this is a comfortable and afordable option to stay in Boston. Sunny beaches nearby!
reviews.title: Good location, less then stellar hotel.

reviews.text: The rooms are clean, and I've never slept better than I did on their bed. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, and the courtesy van from the airport was on time. If you use the transit system, it's a 5 minute walk to the station. If you're looking for new and luxurious downtown, this hotel is not for you, but if you're here to see the sights and get the most value, it's a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Great location and Price

reviews.text: Hotel has a good location near downtown, reasonable price. Check the "specials" for free internet and parking or get stung a bit.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel Good Location

reviews.text: What a disappointment with this hotel. For starters, they charge us twice the account. Since the month of January had made ​​the reservation and paid in full the cost of lodging for three days. We paid a total of $ 534.oo and loaded us back $ 425.oo more. Such! like a five star hotel. This is a very, very, very bad hotel.
reviews.title: DECEPTION TO THIS HOTEL!

reviews.text: Very poor attention in the grocery store on the first floor of the hotel. They have an older lady, very bad-looking, bad temper and so is her all the time.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: In the room: Dirty carpet, can not walk barefoot.
reviews.title: Terrible Hotel

aka: Doubletree Club Boston Bayside Hotel Boston
description: Located just two miles from downtown Boston, our convenient hotel offers easy access to the subway just one block away as well as complimentary shuttle service to downtown Boston, South Station and the airport. Enjoy comfortable accommodations in a standard guest room or upgrade to a newly renovated deluxe room. Grab a quick bite at the Marketplace Café and Take Away with premium deli meats and Starbucks coffee bar.
